definition: to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
desert/unconcerned
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly
to install/to place/to put/to buy
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: Their response to the proposal was, at best, cool.
sentences.chinese: 他们对提议的反应充其量只能说是漠然置之。

sentences.english: He is indifferent to fame and gain, and never cares about them.
sentences.chinese: 对于世俗名利，他总是漠然置之，不放在心上。

sentences.english: Don't turn a blind eye to matters that concern the people's welfare.
sentences.chinese: 不要对民众的利益漠然置之。

sentences.english: The officials were holding loose and not in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 官员们都漠然置之，并不认真对待。

sentences.english: If we do look away, how many others will die?
sentences.chinese: 如果我们漠然置之，还有多少人会死去？

sentences.english: We can, if we choose, discount all of these ghost stories.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们愿意，可以对这些鬼故事漠然置之。

definition: not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
numbed/insensitive/apathetic/thick-skinned
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to feel unconcerned and let matters rest (idiom)
pinyin: shi4 bu4 guan1 ji3 , gao1 gao1 gua4 qi3

definition: see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to blame unscrupulously
to banish from one's thoughts/to ignore/to take no notice
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
to pass by without showing interest (idiom)
